intro: Peucedanum madrense, commonly known as Spanish cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and woodland edges. Its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
